title: Corporal Arthur Marasco pictured at his desk
Scopenote: The Military District of Washington's top photographer, Corporal Arthur Marasco, sits at his desk in his Army office near the Pentagon.  He was drafted out of his own home studio in Seymour, Connecticut, and eventually placed in charge of MDW's photo lab in its headquarters near the Washington National Airport.  On the wall behind is a gallery of his photos.  From:  Arthur Marasco.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Corporal Charles Farber
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shakes hands with former Corporal Charles Farber of Altoona, Pennsylvania. Farber, pictured with his fianc√©e, Helen Baker, is the once unknown Corporal "X" who saved the life of Medal of Honor winner Captain Raymond Harvey after Harvey had been critically wounded on the Korean battlefront. From: Arthur Marasco.

title: Morris A. Shenker, former President Harry S. Truman, and Dr. Norm Probstein at Chase Hotel, St. Louis
Scopenote: Morris A. Shenker (left), former President Harry S. Truman (center), and Dr. Norm Probstein (right) at the Chase Hotel in St. Louis, Missouri, at a fund-raiser for the United Jewish Appeal or Bonds for Israel.  From:  Mickey McTague.

title: Head-and shoulders portrait of Bennett Champ Clark
Scopenote: Head-and-shoulders portrait of Bennet Champ Clark who was a U.S. Senator and Judge.  The photo is autographed (not original) as follows:  "To my good friends of the Key Club with affectionate regards.  Bennett Champ Clark."  The Key Club is associated with St. Louis, Missouri.  From:  Mickey McTague.

title: Printed statement of The Key Club
Scopenote: Printed statement of The Key Club welcoming people to St. Louis, Missouri, signed by the Mayor, Bernard F. (Barney) Dickmann.  From:  Mickey McTague

title: Former President Truman and Harry Vaughan
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left), standing on the rear platform of a train, shakes hands with an unseen admirer in Buffalo, New York.  Standing next to him is Major General Harry H. Vaughan. The event is unknown.  From:  Fred Eckhart.

Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman on the rear platform of a train making a stop in Buffalo, New York.  The date and event are unknown.  From:  Fred Eckhart

title: Housewives for Truman campaign in Amsterdam, New York
Scopenote: In Amsterdam, New York, a group of unidentified women from the Women's Division of the New York State Democratic Committee stand in front of a trailer bearing the words "Housewives for Truman." The same words are repeated on a large sign held by the women in support of Truman in his 1948 campaign.

title: General MacArthur debarks at Washington National Airport
Scopenote: General of the Army Douglas MacArthur debarks from a C-47 transport at MATS Terminal, Washington, D.C., arriving after his dismissal as Far East Supreme Commander.  The two military officers on the ramp are unidentified.  Donor:  Arthur Marasco

title: Housewives for Truman Trailer
Scopenote: In Amsterdam, New York, three unidentified women stand in front of a trailer holding a sign reading "Housewives for Truman."  The same words are displayed on the trailer, sponsored by the Women's Division of the New York State Democratic Committee.

title: Housewives for Truman bus, Mayor Hubert Humphrey and others campaigning in Minneapolis
Scopenote: Women look out the windows of a "Housewives for Truman" bus during the 1948 presidential campaign in Minneapolis, Minnesota.  Standing by the bus are, left to right, Minneapolis Mayor Hubert Humphrey, Mrs. Douglas Hunt, and Mr. Thomas E. Walsh, Chairman, Truman-Barkley Club of Minnesota.  From:  India Edwards

title: India Edwards at Democratic National Committee Headquarters with others
Scopenote: Conference of Democratic National Committee leaders at their headquarters in Washington, D. C.  At left is Senator J. Howard McGrath, committee chairman.  With him are Joseph L. Blythe, treasurer, and Mrs. India Edwards, director of the women's division.

title: Portrait of India Edwards
Scopenote: Head-and-shoulders portrait of India Edwards, Associate Director of the Democratic National Committee  From:  India Edwards

title: Portrait of Katharine Elkus White
Scopenote: Head-and-shoulders portrait of Katharine Elkus White, member of the New Jersey State Democratic Committee, appointed special assistant to India Edwards, Executive Director of the Women's Division of the Democratic National Committee.

title: Katharine Elkus White and Senator Barkley
Scopenote: Senator Alben Barkley and Katharine Elkus White, special assistant to India Edwards (who is Executive Director of the Women's Division of the Democratic National Committee), are shown sitting at a table.  The event takes place during the 1948 campaign, but the exact date and location are unknown.

title: Democratic women at a luncheon
Scopenote: Female backers of the Democratic party are shown at a campaign luncheon in Washington, D.C.  Seated, left to right, are:  Georgia Neese Clark, Richland, Kansas, Democratic National Committeewoman from Kansas; Mrs. Randolph Carpenter, Topeka, Kansas, wife of nominee for Democratic governor of Kansas; Mrs. Margaret Parkin, Cleveland, Ohio, Democratic School Campaign speaker, honored guest; Mrs. Laurence Kliesen, Dodge City, Kansas, State Speakers Bureau Director, Ford County Chairman; and (standing) Mrs. Ralph S. Taite, Lawrence, Kansas, Douglas County Vice Chairman, Ford Demonstrations at School; Mrs. Maree (Tom) Martin, Highland & Wichita, Kansas, Democratic State Public Director, Women's Division; and Mrs. Roxie H. Dana, Topeka, Kansas, State Radio Director, Women's Division.  The date, event, and location are unknown.

title: New York Deputy Mayor John J. Bennett officiates at the opening of a class for first voters
Scopenote: John J. Bennett, Deputy Mayor of New York, officiates at the opening of a class for first voters, held one evening each week at the Women's Division of the Democratic National Committee, Hotel Biltmore, New York.  Also shown are, left to right, Judith H. Methven and Rosalie Smiley, both first voters, and Councilwoman Bertha Schwartz, one of the instructors.

title: India Edwards at podium
Scopenote: India Edwards, Executive Director of the Women's Division, Democratic National Committee, stands at the podium holding a large balloon just released from a box.  The event, date, and location are unidentified but may be during the 1948 Democratic Convention.  (The photo has a portion cut out at left bottom.)

title: India Edwards with unidentified women and a man
Scopenote: Photo of the head of an unidentified man pasted over the original man and surrounded with unidentified women (two pasted on) with the exception of India Edwards, Executive Director of the Women's Division, Democratic National Committee, in the upper left corner.

title: Funeral services for Sergeant 1st Class John Rice at Arlington
Scopenote: Volunteer pallbearers of the 3rd "Old Guard" Infantry Regiment lift the flag over the casket of Sergeant 1st Class John Rice who was killed in action in Korea, September 6, 1950, while leading his squad in a First Cavalry Division attack.  A full-blooded Winnebago Indian, his family had been refused burial of his remains by a cemetery in his native Sioux City, Iowa.  President Truman stepped in and arranged for his burial with full military honors in Arlington National Cemetery.  Family mourners are seated in the front row.  In the wheelchair is Sergeant Rice's mother, Mrs. Samie Davis.  See 77-1710.  From:  Arthur Marasco.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Scopenote: President Harry S. Brazilian President Eurico Gaspar Dutra is seated second from the right. The others are unidentified. Please credit: "Maj. Jerome Eichholz, U.S. Air Force, courtesy Harry S. Truman Library."

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, Bess Truman, and Margaret Truman disembark from "The Independence," which landed at Galeao Airport on Governor's Island, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, Bess Truman, and Margaret Truman disembark from "The Independence," which landed at Galeao Airport on Governor's Island, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. title: Vandenburg, Austin, and Marshall being greeted at an airport in Brazil
Scopenote: Disembarking from a plane are (left to right) Senator Arthur Vandenburg, Chairman of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee; Warren Austin, U.S. Representative to the United Nations; and George Marshall, Secretary of State, who flew to Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, on the presidential plane the "Sacred Cow" to attend the Pan American Conference of Foreign Ministers and the Inter-American Defense Conference.  Shaking hands with Senator Vandenburg is United States Ambassador to Brazil William Pawley, and Lt. Col. Austin is on his Pawley's left, shaking Warren Austin's hand.  Please credit:  "Maj. Jerome Eichholz, U.S. Air Force, courtesy Harry S. Truman Library."

title: Ambassador William D. Pawley, George C. Marshall and Brazilian Minister Raul Fernandes
Scopenote: In Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, for the Pan-American Conference of Foreign Ministers and the Inter-American Defense Conference, Secretary of State George C. title: Marshall and Austin at an airport in Brazil
Scopenote: With the "Sacred Cow" in the background, Secretary of State George C. Marshall (left) and Warren Austin (right), U.S. Representative to the United Nations, are greeted by Brazilian Minister Raul Fernandes (center).  They are in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, to attend the Pan-American Conference of Foreign Ministers and the Inter-American Defense Conference.  Please credit:  "Maj. title: Senator Vandenburg in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
Scopenote: Senator Arthur Vandenburg, Chairman of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, stands by a car in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, where he is to attend the Pan-American Conference of Foreign Ministers.  Please credit:  "Maj. Jerome Eichholz, U.S. Air Force, courtesy Harry S. Truman, Library."

title: Remains of Sergeant 1st Class John Rice carried through Arlington Cemetery
Scopenote: The traditional artillery funeral caisson carrying the remains of Sergeant 1st Class John Rice wends its way through Arlington National Cemetery to the grave.  A full-blooded Winnebago Indian, his family had been refused burial of his remains by a cemetery in his native Sioux City, Iowa.  President Harry S. Truman stepped in and arranged for his burial with full military honors in Arlington National Cemetery.  Sgt. Rice was killed in action in Korea, September 6, 1950.  See also 77-1710.  From:  Arthur Marasco.

Scopenote: Under the wing of the "Independence," President Harry S. Truman (third from left) and Secretary of State George C. All others are unidentified.  Please credit:  "Maj. Jerome Eichholz, U.S. Air Force, courtesy Harry S. Truman Library."

Jerome Eichholz, U.S. Air Force, courtesy Harry S. Truman Library."

Scopenote: Major Jerome Eichholz and two unidentified men stand in front of the presidential plane "The Independence" in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.  Please credit:  "Maj. Jerome Eichholz, U.S. Air Force, courtesy Harry S. Truman Library."

title: President Truman and others welcome Princess Elizabeth and Prince Phillip
Scopenote: Princess Elizabeth of England and her Prince Consort, Philip, Duke of Edinburgh, arrive at MATS Terminal, Washington National Airport. (See 86-141.)  From:  Arthur Marasco, 667 East Street, Lenox, MA 01240

title: John Kerry and staff of the Truman Library
Scopenote: Senator John Kerry, 2004 Democratic candidate for President, poses for a picture with the Truman Library staff, taken in the North Lobby of the Truman Library.  Left to right are:  Mary McPherson, Kathy Knotts, Anita Henderson, Ray Geselbracht, Carol Banes, Donna Denslow, Judy Kreher, Jim Todd (partially obscured), Senator John Kerry, Scott Roley (partially obscured), Amy Williams, Rebecca Turner, Bonnie Neeleman, Anita Smith, Steve Belk, Jamie Oakes, Ed Autry, Pauline Testerman, and Randy Sowell.  The candidate spoke on national security.  From:  Sharon Farmer, photographer for the Kerry campaign.

title: Truman and Clyde T. Ellis at a breakfast in the Willard Hotel
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (right) and Clyde T. Ellis chat at a breakfast held at the Willard Hotel in Washington, D.C., where the former President spoke to members of the National Rural Electric Cooperative Association in the Electric Consumers Workshop.  From: Clyde T. Ellis.

title: Truman speaks at an Electric Consumers Workshop
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman addresses members of the National Rural Electric Cooperative Association at an Electric Consumers Workshop breakfast held at the Willard Hotel, Washington, D.C.  All others are unidentified.  From: Clyde T. Ellis.

title: Truman in a four-way handshake with Clyde T. Ellis and two unidentified men
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (second from the right) is shown in a four-way handshake with Clyde T. title: Truman and Clyde T. Ellis at the Willard Hotel in Washington, D.C.
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left) and Clyde T. title: Truman with National Employ the Physically Handicapped Committee
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing at podium, left), with select members of the President's Committee to Employ the Physically Handicapped.  All other than President Truman are unidentified.

title: General MacArthur and family at Washington National Airport
Scopenote: General Douglas MacArthur is pictured at Washington National Airport's MATS Terminal after debarking with his family from the airplane "BATAAN." title: Former President Truman presents a 50-year pin at the Grandview Masonic Temple
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (right), Past Grand Master of the Grand Lodge of Missouri, Ancient Free and Accepted Masons, presents a Fifty-Year pin to W. Bro. Harry S. Wintermute in the Grandview, Missouri Masonic Temple room.  The Lodge Senior Warden can be seen in the background.  From:  Bert W. Casselman.

title: Truman in Oroville, California, during the 1952 campaign
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman smiles from the rear platform of a train at a stop in Oroville, California, during a 1952 campaign trip for the Democratic ticket.  The other man is unidentified.  (Original negative included.)  From:  Albert Camargo.

title: Former President Truman and others on Mackinac Island, Michigan
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (second from left), visiting Mackinac Island, Michigan, is presented with funds for the Truman Library by members of the Brotherhood of Maintenance of Way Employees.  Others in the photo are unidentified.  From:  T.C. Carroll.

title: Former President Truman on Mackinac Island, Michigan
Scopenote: On Mackinac Island, Michigan, former President Harry S. Truman (center) stands between two unidentified members of the Brotherhood of Maintenance of Way Employees.  The organization had presented funds to the former President for his new library.  From:  T.C. Carroll.

title: Truman walks in front of Blair House, Washington, D.C.

Truman is shown on his daily walk from his White House Office to Blair House, Washington, D.C. From: William E. Carnahan. Please credit: "Photography by William E. Carnahan, Silver Spring, MD."

title: Final honors for former President Harry S. Truman at Ft. Shafter, Hawaii
Scopenote: As palm trees sway in the breeze, the flag is lowered at Palm Circle, Ft. Shafter, Hawaii, as former President Harry S. Truman receives final honors from Battery C, 3rd Battalion, 13th Field Artillery, 25th Infantry Division Artillery.  From:  William E. Carlson, Colonel, FA, Commanding, Dept of the Army.

title: President Harry S. Truman in a Motorcade in Flint, Michigan
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman sits atop the back seat of a Buick convertible as he drives past the Hollywood Grill during his motorcade through Flint, Michigan, on a campaign stop there.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Appears on the Ted Mack Show
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (second from right) shakes hands with Ted Mack (right) on stage during the Ted Mack Show. Standing on the left is Frank Land.    From:  Charlie Campbell.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Appears on the Ted Mack Show
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (second from left) and Ted Mack (right) jointly hold a plaque as the former President appears on the Ted Mack Show.  Standing on the left is Frank Land.   From:  Charlie Campbell.

title: Former President Truman walks down the street with Charlie Campbell
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left), wearing an overcoat and carrying a cane, walks down a residential street with Charlie Campbell, photographer.  The date and location are unknown.  The photo is autographed:  To Mr. Truman with true regards, Charlie Campbell.

title: President Truman, Acheson, Marshall, and Eisenhower

title: Former President Truman in Fort Wayne, Indiana

title: Former President Truman and others on their way to a rally in Fort Wayne, Indiana

title: Former President Truman at a rally in Fort Wayne, Indiana
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (second from the left) sits at a table at a rally in Fort Wayne, Indiana, for Vance Hartke, Democratic candidate for Senator from Indiana.  Bending over Truman is Vance Hartke, and at the podium is Alexander Campbell.  The other man is unidentified.

title: Former President Truman speaks at a rally in Fort Wayne, Indiana
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman holds three books while addressing a rally in Fort Wayne, Indiana, for Democratic Candidate for Senator Vance Hartke of Indiana.  Seated at the second table, second from left, is Alexander Campbell.  The others are unidentified.

title: Former President Truman at a rally in Fort Wayne, Indiana
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (first man on the left) grins for the camera at a rally in Fort Wayne, Indiana, for Vance Hartke, Democratic candidate for Senator from Indiana.  At the podium is Alexander Campbell.  The others are unidentified.

title: Truman and others at an airfield in Fort Wayne, Indiana
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (third from the left) shakes hands with an unidentified man as he stands in front of an airplane after his arrival in Fort Wayne, Indiana, for a political rally.  Alexander Campbell is on Truman's left.  The others are unidentified.  Mr. Truman is in Fort Wayne to attend a rally for Vance Hartke, the Democratic Senatorial candidate.

title: Former President Truman at a luncheon in Fort Wayne, Indiana
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman sits at the head of the table at a luncheon in Fort Wayne, Indiana.  Behind him on his right is Alexander Campbell.  The others are not identified.  Mr. Truman is in Fort Wayne to attend a rally for Vance Hartke, the Democratic Senatorial candidate.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman at a rally in Fort Wayne, Indiana
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (fourth from the left) sits on a motorized cart surrounded by a group of unidentified political associates.  Mr. Truman is in Fort Wayne, Indiana, on his way to a rally for Vance Hartke, Democratic Senatorial candidate.

title: Former President Truman and others at rally in Fort Wayne, Indiana
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (front row, right) sits at the speakers' table at a rally in Fort Wayne, Indiana, for Democratic candidate for Senator Vance Hartke (on Truman's left).  Others surrounding the former President are unidentified.

title: Truman and others at a rally in Fort Wayne, Indiana
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (front row, second from left) and a group of unidentified men walk down a corridor to the front of a hall in Fort Wayne, Indiana.  Truman is in Fort Wayne to speak at a rally for Vance Hartke, Democratic candidate for Senator.  From:  Alexander Campbell.

title: President Truman wishes good luck to General Eisenhower

Scopenote: Faded (purplish) color snapshot of former President Harry S. Truman (left) and Portland, Oregon Mayor Fred L. Scopenote: Parade Rest for the honor guards of the 3rd "Old Guard" Infantry Regiment (Fort Myer, Virginia, and Fort McNair, D.C.) as they await the start of a traditional wreath-laying ceremony on the plaza of the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier in Arlington National Cemetery. title: Truman and Charles Patrick Clark and others at Mayflower Hotel

From:  Charles Patrick Clark.

title: Former President Truman speaks with John L. Lewis

title: Former President Truman and John L. Lewis at the Mayflower Hotel

Clark, The Scranton Times, Scranton, Pennsylvania.

title: Truman attends a St. Patrick Day dinner in Scranton, Pennsylvania
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (seated at table, sixth from the left) is seated at the head table at a dinner hosted by the Friendly Sons of St. Patrick in Scranton, Pennsylvania, with members and guests shown standing behind and sitting in front of the table.  From:  George E. Clark, The Scranton Times, Scranton, Pennsylvania.

title: Truman with "Friendly Sons of St. Patrick" in Scranton, Pennsylvania
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman, in Scranton, Pennsylvania, to attend a dinner hosted by the Friendly Sons of St. Patrick, is photographed with six members of the organization. Eagen, Dr. John Corcoran, Attorney William P. Farrell, Thomas F. Murphy, and Kenneth O' Brien.  From:  George E. Clark, The Scranton Times, Scranton, Pennsylvania

title: President Truman and England's Princess Elizabeth at airport podium
Scopenote: Princess Elizabeth of England (left) and President Harry S. Truman speak to the crowd who gathered at Washington National Airport's MATS Terminal to see Elizabeth set foot for the first time on American soil.  President Truman, standing with her on the rostrum, had earlier given her and her prince consort a greeting to America.  See also 72-694.  From:  Arthur Marasco.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (on platform, left) receives a gift (German pistol) from Stevie Stoltz on the rear platform of a train at Springfield, Missouri. title: Truman greets British Prime Minister Attlee at Potsdam, Germany
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, left) greets British Prime Minister Clement Attlee (right) at the conference table at Potsdam, Germany. From:  Cyril Clemens, Mark Twain Journal, Kirkwood, Missouri.

Truman (second from the left) chats with members of the Press and Union League Club who had gathered for a "Gang Dinner" in San Francisco, California. Left to right are:  Captain I.E. McMillian, United States Navy, Mr. Truman, Judge Byron Arnold, and Maurice J. Lynch.

Scopenote: Snapshot of former President Harry S. Truman's mother, Martha Ellen Truman, standing in front of the bungalow in Grandview, Missouri.  Same as 2003-167.  From:  Mr. and Mrs. Andrew T. McMillan.

Scopenote: Snapshot of former President Harry S. Truman's mother, Martha Ellen Truman, wearing a fox fur and standing in front of her Grandview, Missouri bungalow.    From:  Mr. and Mrs. Andrew T. McMillan.

title: Snapshot of Martha Ellen Truman
Scopenote: Head-and-shoulders snapshot of former President Harry S. Truman's mother, Martha Ellen Truman, standing in front of her Grandview, Missouri home and wearing a fox fur around her neck.  From:  Mr. and Mrs. Andrew T. McMillan.

title: Snapshot of Martha Ellen Truman, seated in front of home
Scopenote: Snapshot of former President Harry S. Truman's mother, Martha Ellen Truman, sitting in a chair in front of her Grandview, Missouri bungalow.  From:  Mr. and Mrs. Andrew T. McMillan.

title: Snapshot of Martha Ellen Truman and Mary Jane Truman
Scopenote: Snapshot of former President Harry S. Truman's mother, Martha Ellen Truman (left), and sister, Mary Jane Truman, standing in front of the Grandview, Missouri bungalow, taken on the occasion of "Aunt Matt's" 91st birthday.   From:  Mr. and Mrs. Andrew T. McMillan.

title: Snapshot of Martha Ellen Truman and Mary Jane Truman
Scopenote: Snapshot of former President Harry S. Truman's mother, Martha Ellen Truman (left), and sister, Mary Jane Truman, standing in front of their Grandview, Missouri bungalow.  From:  Mr. and Mrs. Andrew T. McMillan.

title: President Truman at dedication of the Bull Shoals Dam
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right), shaking hands with Carl Miller, Chief of the Arkansas State Police, at the dedication of the Bull Shoals Dam.  On Miller's left is J.D. King, Sheriff of Baxter County, Arkansas, and on Truman's right is Arkansas Governor Sid McMath.    From:  Sara McLaughlin.

title: Margaret Truman in Salzburg, Austria with others
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (center), daughter of President Harry S. Truman, visits Salzburg, Austria.  She is shown carrying a bouquet of flowers, accompanied by her friend, Mrs. John Horton (Drucie Snyder)(left), daughter of U.S. Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder, and welcomed by U.S. Ambassador to Canada, Stanley Woodward (right), on whose estate she will enjoy a few days of rest.  From:  Eileen McLoughlin.

title: President and Mrs. Truman welcome Netherlands Queen Juliana and Prince Bernhard
Scopenote: A royal welcome for Juliana, Queen of the Netherlands, and her consort, Prince Bernhard, in front of the Old District Building by President and Mrs. Truman and citizens of Washington, D.C.  Pictured beneath the canopy, front row (left to right), are Queen Juliana, President Harry S. Truman, an unidentified District Commissioner, Prince Bernhard, and Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman. See album - 66-8049 through 8115.  From:  Arthur Marasco.

title: Portrait of Margaret Truman taken on vacation in Salzburg, Austria
Scopenote: Portrait of Margaret Truman taken in  Salzburg, Austria, where she spent a few days of rest on the estate of the American Ambassador to Canada, Stanley Woodward, during her European vacation.  (See 2005-59.)    From:  Eileen McLoughlin.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Roscoe L. McCrary
Scopenote: Newly elected President Harry S. Truman (second from the left) shakes hands with Roscoe L. McCrary (second from the right) of the Chicago Defender, St. Louis Bureau, on the back platform of the train taking Mr. Truman back to Washington, D.C. after the 1948 election.  The other two men are unidentified.  From:  Roscoe L. McCrary

title: President Truman boarding the Independence
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman waves goodbye at Washington National Airport's MATS terminal as he prepares to board the Independence for his summer White House at Key West.

Scopenote: Bess Truman (third from the left) is shown attending a formal dinner with others who are unidentified.  The event, date, and location are unknown.  From:  Nancy Ehrlich, Jackson County Historical Society

title: Portrait of Virginia Elizabeth Colgan
Scopenote: Portrait of Virginia Elizabeth Colgan as a young girl in a plaid dress.  Colgans were cousins of former President Harry S. Truman.  From:  Nancy Ehrlich, Jackson County Historical Society

title: Studio portrait of Virginia Elizabeth Colgan
Scopenote: Studio portrait of Virginia Elizabeth Colgan taken during her teens.  The Colgans were cousins of former President Harry S. Truman.  From:  Nancy Ehrlich, Jackson County Historical Society

title: Portrait of Virginia Colgan as a young woman
Scopenote: Head-and-shoulders studio portrait of Virginia Elizabeth Colgan as a young woman.  The Colgan's were cousins of former President Harry S. Truman.  From:  Nancy Ehrlich, Jackson County Historical Society

title: Virginia, Murray, Milbra, and Rochester Colgan in the yard on Overton Street in Independence
Scopenote: Colgan family members pose in the front yard of a house on Overton Street in Independence, Missouri, built by Murray Truman Colgan.  Sitting on a swing are Murray Truman Colgan and Milbra "Colga"  Colgan.  Sitting on the ground in front of them are Virginia Elizabeth Colgan (later to marry R.E. Bruner) and Rochester Campbell Colgan.  Murray Truman Colgan's mother was Emily Ricks Truman, sister of John Anderson Truman.  From:  Nancy Ehrlich, Jackson County Historical Society.

title: Roma Spencer and Frances Hill
Scopenote: Photo, taken out of doors in winter, left to right, of Roma Spencer (later Mrs. Rochester C. Colgan II, a relative of President Truman) and Frances Hill (mother of donor, Nancy Ehrlich) dressed in fur-trimmed coats.  From:  Nancy Ehrlich, Jackson County Historical Society

title: Frances Hill in fur-trimmed winter coat
Scopenote: Frances Hill (mother of donor Nancy Ehrlich) poses out of doors in a fur-trimmed winter coat.  Frances Hill was a friend of the Colgans, cousins of former President Harry S. Truman.  From:  Nancy Ehrlich, Jackson County Historical Society

title: Photo of Frances Hill with Virginia, Milbra, and Roma Colgan
Scopenote: In fur-trimmed winter coats and hats,  four ladies strike a pose for the camera.  Left to right are:  Frances Hill, Virginia Elizabeth Colgan Bruner (daughter of Murray Truman Colgan and Milbra "Colga" Colgan), Milbra "Colga" Colgan (wife of Murray Truman Colgan), and Roma Spencer Colgan. Murray Truman Colgan's mother was Emily Ricks Truman Colgan, sister of John Anderson Truman, the father of former President Harry S. Truman.  From:  Nancy Ehrlich, Jackson County Historical Society

title: Group picture of the Colgan family
Scopenote: Colgan family members pose out of doors by their house.  Left to right are:  Murray Truman Colgan, Milbra "Colga" Colgan (wife of Murray), daughter Virginia Elizabeth Colgan (Mrs. Bruner), and son Rochester Campbell Colgan, II.  Murray Truman Colgan's mother was Emily Ricks Truman Colgan, sister of John Anderson Truman, the father of former President Harry S. Truman.  From:  Nancy Ehrlich, Jackson County Historical Society

title: Photo of Rochester Campbell Colgan, II
Scopenote: Rochester Campbell Colgan, II, son of Murray Truman Colgan, poses for an out-of-doors photo, with hat and sunglasses obscuring part of his face.  Murray Truman Colgan's mother was Emily Ricks Truman Colgan, sister of John Anderson Truman, former President Harry S. Truman's father.  From:  Nancy Ehrlich, Jackson County Historical Society

title: President Truman and Churchill at Washington National Airport
Scopenote: Standing before microphones, President Harry S. Truman (right) has off-the-cuff words of welcome for British Prime Minister Winston Churchill (left) after he alighted from "The Independence" at MATS Terminal, Washington National Airport, on an official visit.  See also 67-7575 thru 7578.  From:  Arthur Marasco, 667 East Street, Lenox, MA 01240

title: Photo of the Colgan family, Rochester Campbell, Roma Spencer, Milbra, Virginia, and Murray Truman
Scopenote: Sitting out of doors on lawn furniture are, left to right, Roma Spencer Colgan, Milbra "Colga" Colgan (Mrs. Murray Colgan), and Virginia Elizabeth Colgan (Mrs. Bruner).  The two men standing are Rochester Campbell Colgan II (left); and Murray Truman Colgan.  The family met to celebrate the silver wedding anniversary of Murray Truman and Milbra "Colga" Colgan.  (See 2005-81 and 82.)  Murray Truman Colgan's mother was Emily Ricks Truman Colgan, sister of John Anderson Truman, father of former President Harry S. Truman.  From:  Nancy Ehrlich, Jackson County Historical Society

title: Silver wedding anniversary of Murray Truman Colgans
Scopenote: Murray Truman Colgan and Milbra "Colga" Colgan sit on a lawn chair surrounded by flowers as they pose for a Silver Wedding Anniversary photo.  Murray Truman Colgan's mother was Emily Ricks Truman Colgan, sister of John Anderson Truman, former President Harry S. Truman's father.  From:  Nancy Ehrlich, Jackson County Historical Society

title: Silver wedding anniversary of the Murray Truman Colgans
Scopenote: Murray Truman Colgan and Milbra "Colga" Colgan sit on a lawn chair surrounded by flowers as they pose for a Silver Wedding Anniversary photo. Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (right) chats with Abba Eban (left), Ambassador of Israel. The location and event are unknown. The photo is autographed as follows: "To a great President, In deep respect, Abba Eban, August 1955." From: Abba Eban, Ambassador of Israel, Embassy of Israel, Washington, D.C.

title: Cyrus Eaton and Former President Harry S. Truman at a Press Conference
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. title: Former President Harry S. Truman with Cyrus Eaton at Eaton's farm
Scopenote: On a tour of Acadia Farms in Northfield, Ohio, Cyrus Eaton (left), owner and financier, shows former President Harry S. Truman (right) a prize bull. The former President came to Cleveland, Ohio, to attend a fund-raising dinner for the library that is to hold his official papers. title: Replica of Philadelphia Liberty Bell in gazebo in front of Memorial Building
Scopenote: Snapshot of a 2,500 pound replica of the Philadelphia Liberty Bell in a gazebo in front of Memorial Hall in Independence, Missouri. The bell, a friendship token from the people of Annecy, France, was formally accepted by President Harry S. Truman on behalf of Independence and the United States at ceremonies held on November 6, 1950. Fifty-three bells, one for each state and territory, were cast and sent as gifts to the United States. From: A.W. Easter.

title: Replica of Philadelphia Liberty Bell in gazebo in Independence, Memorial Hall
Scopenote: Snapshot of a 2,500 pound replica of the Philadelphia Liberty Bell in a gazebo in front of Memorial Hall in Independence, Missouri.  The bell, a friendship token from the people of Annecy, France, was formally accepted by President Harry S. Truman on behalf of Independence and the United States.  Fifty-three bells were cast and sent as gifts to the United States, one for each state and territory.  From:  A.W. Easter.

title: President Truman and others view Armed Forces Day parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and others view the annual Armed Forces Day parade from the Presidential Reviewing Stand on the Ellipse.  Viewers (left to right - front row) are:  Rear Admiral Robert L. Dennison, Navy Aide to the President; Brigadier General Morris J. Lee, Commander of Bolling Air Force Base, D.C., and officer-in-charge of Washington, D.C. area celebrations of the event; President Truman; Major General Harry Vaughan, Military Aide to the President, and Major General Robert B. Landry, Air Force Aide to the President.  The others are unidentified.  From:  Arthur Marasco.

title: Memorial Building, Independence, Missouri, at Liberty Bell dedication
Scopenote: Snapshot of the Memorial Building in Independence, Missouri, with a 2,500 pound replica of the Philadelphia Liberty Bell in a gazebo in front of the building.  The bell, a friendship token from the people of Annecy, France, will be formally accepted by President Harry S. Truman on behalf of Independence and the United States.  Chairs have been set up in front of the building, and the street has been blocked off.  From:  A.W. Easter.

title: Dedication of the Liberty Bell Replica in Independence, Missouri
Scopenote: Snapshot of Mayor Georges Volland of Annecy-le-Vieux, France, at the podium in front of Memorial Hall, Independence, Missouri.  On behalf of the French, a 2,500 pound replica of the Liberty Bell was presented to Independence, Missouri, at a ceremony presided over by President Harry S. Truman.  From:  A.W. Easter.

title: President Truman speaks at Liberty Bell replica dedication
Scopenote: Snapshot of President Harry S. Truman at the podium in front of Memorial Hall, Independence, Missouri, at the dedication of a replica of the Liberty Bell which was sent to Independence by the people of Annecy, France.  See also 77-2318.  From:  A.W. Easter.

title: President Truman speaks at Liberty Bell replica dedication
Scopenote: Snapshot of President Harry S. Truman at the podium in front of Memorial Hall, Independence, Missouri, at the dedication of a replica of the Liberty Bell which was sent to Independence by the people of Annecy, France.  See also 77-2318.  From:  A.W. Easter.

title: Mayor Weatherford speaks at dedication of replica of the Liberty Bell
Scopenote: Standing behind the podium at Memorial Hall, Robert Weatherford, Mayor of Independence, Missouri, speaks during the dedication of a 2,500-pound replica of the Philadelphia Liberty Bell which was sent to Independence by the people of Annecy, France and was formally accepted by President Harry S. Truman on behalf of Independence and the United States.  President Truman is seated just to the right of the flag on the right.  All others are unidentified.  From:  A.W. Easter.

title: Independence Mayor Robert Weatherford speaks at the dedication of a replica of the Liberty Bell
Scopenote: Standing behind the podium at Memorial Hall, Independence, Missouri Mayor Robert Weatherford speaks during the dedication of a 2,500-pound replica of the Philadelphia Liberty Bell which was sent to Independence by the people of Annecy, France, and was formally accepted by President Harry S. Truman on behalf of Independence and the United States.  In front, on the street, can be seen members of an ROTC color guard from William Jewell College.  From:  A.W. Easter.

title: Jackson County, Missouri Courthouse
Scopenote: Snapshot of the Jackson County Courthouse in Independence, Missouri.

title: Sign in front of the Jackson County Courthouse, Independence, Missouri
Scopenote: Snapshot of monument erected in 1948 at the Jackson County Courthouse in Independence, Missouri, by order of the Jackson County Court, which reads:  Here the Oregon Trail began.  This monument honors the pioneer spirit of those courageous men and women who, by their heroic trek across the continent, established homes and civilization in the far northwest.  From:  A.W. Easter.

title: President Harry S. Truman conversing with Lt. Ralph Sherman aboard the U.S.S. Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, visiting aboard the U.S.S. Missouri, converses with Navy Lieutenant Ralph Ingram Sherman, USN (center), as he was introduced to the ship's personnel.  The President was on board for an official state visit to Brazil.  From:  J. Carol Sherman McVicker.

title: Portrait of President Truman sitting at his desk
